actr.model

Class Buffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • actr.model.Buffers

  • public class Buffers
extends java.lang.Object
    Maintains the state of the ACT-R buffers.
    Author:
    Dario Salvucci

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Chunk get(Symbol buffer)
      Gets the chunk in the specified buffer.
      Chunk getBufferChunk(Symbol name)
      Gets a buffer chunk by the name of that chunk.
      Symbol getSlot(Symbol buffer, Symbol slot)
      Gets the slot value of a buffer chunk.
      boolean isLegalBuffer(Symbol symbol)
      Checks whether the given symbol is a legal buffer symbol by checking for the presence of a state buffer for that symbol.
      boolean isState(Symbol buffer)
      Checks whether the specified buffer is a state buffer with a '?' prefix.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Gets a string representation of the buffers showing existing buffers and their content.

    • Method Detail

      • isLegalBuffer

        public boolean isLegalBuffer(Symbol symbol)
        Checks whether the given symbol is a legal buffer symbol by checking for the presence of a state buffer for that symbol.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol
        Returns:
        true if the symbol is a legal buffer symbol

      • isState

        public boolean isState(Symbol buffer)
        Checks whether the specified buffer is a state buffer with a '?' prefix.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer
        Returns:
        true if the buffer is state buffer

      • get

        public Chunk get(Symbol buffer)
        Gets the chunk in the specified buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer name (without a prefix for normal buffers but with the '?' prefix for state buffers)
        Returns:
        the buffer chunk, or null if the buffer is empty

      • getSlot

        public Symbol getSlot(Symbol buffer,
                      Symbol slot)
        Gets the slot value of a buffer chunk.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer name (without a prefix for normal buffers but with the '?' prefix for state buffers)
        slot - the slot to be accessed
        Returns:
        the value of the slot, or null if the buffer or slot is empty

      • getBufferChunk

        public Chunk getBufferChunk(Symbol name)
        Gets a buffer chunk by the name of that chunk.
        Parameters:
        name - the chunk name
        Returns:
        the buffer chunk, or null if the chunk name does not exist

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a string representation of the buffers showing existing buffers and their content.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string
